definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]

sentences.english: This performance was a success and he was greeted by enthusiastic applause.
sentences.chinese: 这场音乐会相当成功，马友友被报以热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: Joan doesn't say anything, replying him a sincere phiz .
sentences.chinese: 贞德没有说话，只报以一个真诚的眼神。

sentences.english: She was so tender and beautiful, and for your cry has responded with silence.
sentences.chinese: 她那么娇艳，对你的呼求却报以沉默。

sentences.english: His speeches were met with catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 对他的演讲，人们报以嘘声。

sentences.english: The audience loaded the champion with thunderous applause.
sentences.chinese: 观众向冠军报以暴风雨般的掌声。
听了这话，女推销员彬彬有礼地报以微笑。

sentences.english: We hope and we have suggested that they will do it in manner that is not antagonistic.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望并建议政府不要报以敌对态度来做这件事。

sentences.english: Mother gave it an extremely loathing look, but the baby returned her look with a catlike smile.
sentences.chinese: 母亲表示出十分的厌恶，她却报以母亲猫一样的微笑。

sentences.english: Ambassador Liu's gracious speech and answers were rewarded with rounds of ardent applause from the audience.
sentences.chinese: 现场听众对刘大使的精彩演讲和答问报以热烈掌声。

sentences.english: Initial reaction to the move on Wall Street and elsewhere has been cautiously positive.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街和其他地方对此举最初报以谨慎的肯定。

sentences.english: So absurd rodomontade , people nature can be anounced derisive.
sentences.chinese: 如此荒谬的自吹，人们自然会报以嘲笑。

sentences.english: She requited his love with coldness.
sentences.chinese: 她对他的爱报以冷淡态度。

sentences.english: Cast a cold eye , on life , on death.
But now we're being rewarded with bigger profits.
sentences.chinese: 但现在我们被报以更大的利益。

sentences.english: The class greeted my suggestion with boos and hisses.
sentences.chinese: 全班人对我的建议报以一片唏嘘声。

sentences.english: His remark was greeted with hisses.

definition: hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
